item.title: Is it possible for a Member State to be expelled or suspended from the EU? An updated summary of Article 7 of the Treaty on European Union.
item.description: ProfessorÂ Steve Peers, University of Essex The re-election of Hungary’s Orban government has led some critics to demand Hungary’s expulsion from the EU. This raises questions about the possibility of such an action and the available sanctions the EU can impose on its members. This post revisits and updates earlier discussions on this topic, focusing on the ‘Article 7’ process for addressing breaches of the rule of law and other EU values by Member States.
